repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body: I wonder if we should be prepared for this to run out of '.'s and not generate a valid qualname. In which case qualname should probably just be `NULL` and the optimized loopup skipped
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2917,6 +2919,20 @@ def analyse_types(self, env):
                 IdentifierStringNode(self.module_name.pos, value=part)
                 for part in map(StringEncoding.EncodedString, self.module_name.value.split('.'))
             ]).analyse_types(env)
+        if self.level > 0:
+            qualname = env.global_scope().qualified_name
+            for _ in range(self.level):
+                qualname, _, _ = qualname.rpartition('.')

comment_data.body:
I don't know if this makes sense for the `level=-1` case (which admittedly is trying to emulated old behaviour).
Again I think the solution is probably not to pass a qualname and to skip the optimized lookup.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2917,6 +2919,20 @@ def analyse_types(self, env):
                 IdentifierStringNode(self.module_name.pos, value=part)
                 for part in map(StringEncoding.EncodedString, self.module_name.value.split('.'))
             ]).analyse_types(env)
+        if self.level > 0:
+            qualname = env.global_scope().qualified_name
+            for _ in range(self.level):
+                qualname, _, _ = qualname.rpartition('.')
+            qualname = IdentifierStringNode(
+                self.module_name.pos,
+                value=StringEncoding.EncodedString(f"{qualname}.{self.module_name.value}"),
+            ).analyse_types(env)
+        else:
+            qualname = IdentifierStringNode(
+                self.module_name.pos,
+                value=StringEncoding.EncodedString(self.module_name.value),
+            ).analyse_types(env)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
                int hasattr = PyObject_HasAttr(module, item);
```

This'd probably be better to not worry about error handling
I'm not completely sure if this is removable or not.
I thought it is because `__Pyx_Import` which is called right above this include the lookup in `sys.modules` now.

Please give these variables better names. They are not just what their type says, they have a semantic meaning. Proposal:
`list` -> `name_parts`
`listsize` -> `part_count`
`listitem` -> `top_level_package_name`

Similar naming would help in the other functions as well.

commit.message: Speed up reimports by checking sys.module before trying to import
